questions.question_text: Which of the following approaches provides the BEST assurance and user confidence when an organization migrates data to a more complex enterprise resource planning (ERP) system?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The answer is B because it allows users to compare the outputs to ensure that the new system performs accurately and reliably before fully transitioning. Parallel processing it allows for immediate verification of data integrity and system functionality, which is crucial in complex ERP environments. I feel the key work here is 'data migration' and not development of the complex ERP system. In the case of development, i would choose C as the best approach would be to implement the system in stages.

Selected Answer: C
Parallel processing (option B) involves running both the old and new systems simultaneously for a period, which can be resource-intensive and complex. It requires synchronization of data between systems and can lead to confusion if discrepancies arise between the old and new systems.

Therefore, phased changeover is generally considered the BEST approach for ensuring assurance and user confidence when migrating data to a more complex ERP system.

questions.question_text: During an ongoing audit, management requests a briefing on the findings to date. Which of the following is the IS auditor's BEST course of action?

choices.C: Review working papers with the auditee.
choices.B: Request the auditee provide management responses.
choices.A: Request management wait until a final report is ready for discussion.

discussion.content: D. Present observations for discussion only.

Selected Answer: D
Answer: D

Selected Answer: D
not final, but discussion only

Selected Answer: D
The auditor will only share findings during the audit for the sole purpose of agreeing them with management.

comments.content: Any other option is not the best course of action as it may not be an appropriate response to management's requests and may delay the sharing of information.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
most naturally with D)

the client ( Management) pays the auditor for an audit, and wants an update, even during the audit, from the auditor not from the auditee. 
Also you never say no to a cient if he wants an update at any period of the audit. 

So D is the answer, just for discussion.. Nothing formal.

By requesting the auditee to provide management responses, the IS auditor can ensure that management is informed of the audit findings and recommendations in a timely and accurate manner, while also providing the auditee with an opportunity to explain their perspective and proposed actions. This approach can enhance the credibility and transparency of the audit process, promote collaboration and cooperation between the IS auditor and the auditee, and increase the likelihood of effective follow-up and monitoring of the audit recommendations.

Running historical transactions through the new system

comments.content: The most assurance over the completeness and accuracy of loan application processing with respect to the implementation of a new system can be obtained by running historical transactions through the new system. Historical transactions are transactions that have been processed and recorded by the old system in the past. Running historical transactions through the new system can provide the most assurance over the completeness and accuracy of loan application processing, by comparing the results and outputs of the new system with those of the old system, and verifying whether they match or differ. This can help identify and resolve any errors or issues that may arise from the new system, such as data conversion, functionality, compatibility, etc. Comparing code between old and new systems is a possible way to obtain some assurance over the completeness and accuracy of loan application processing with respect to the implementation of a new system, but it is not the most effective one.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the PRIMARY concern when negotiating a contract for a hot site?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
While reciprocal agreements with other organizations (Option C) may be beneficial for sharing resources or facilities in certain situations, ensuring the availability of the hot site during multiple disaster declarations is of paramount importance for maintaining business continuity and minimizing the impact of disasters on organizational operations.
B. Availability of the site in the event of multiple disaster declarations

choices.D: Coordination with the site staff in the event of multiple disaster declarations
choices.A: Complete testing of the recovery plan
choices.B: Availability of the site in the event of multiple disaster declarations
